intro: Ornithoboea barbanthera, commonly known as the bird's-beak balm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Ornithoboea barbanthera is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
